data.title: Songbirds
data.author: nutty7t
data.description: You are a lovebird, and you are trying to attract another lovebird. In order to do that, you must use your aural skills to sing back the melodies that you hear.

data.title: Noegnud
data.author: Sascha Depold | eBay Tech
data.description: Noegnud is a tiny dungeon crawler in which you started with a randomly skilled hero on the bottom most floor. After every second finished round you'll have to remove one of your skills and make it all the BACK to the top of the dungeon.

data.title: Gem of truth
data.author: Ryan Chen
data.description:
A 2D game of a story about fighting monsters and bring BACK the gem of truth.
Discover the secret in the land of gems! The maze will be refreshed every 5 minutes for all the players.

data.title: Marshmallow playback
data.author: Gabor Heja
data.description: Help the marshmallow fellas to collect all the stars. They need to cooperate and avoid deadly traps. You have limited time, after that comes the playback.

data.title: Backbeat
data.author: razh
data.description: [Incomplete]

data.title: Pew Pew
data.author: FROSTIN/BLUEPIE
data.description:
Description
Meet Koko! Your average girl with the power to make a barrier around her and absorb bullet's energy when it hits the barrier. She can also use the adsorbed energy to fire back at the enemies.

data.title: Back to the beginning
data.author: Danny Li / Machine tan
data.description: back to the beginning

data.title: racer
data.author: James
data.description: Start from the back of the pack, finish 1st to go to the next race!

data.title: Zooback Rider
data.author: Curtastic
data.description: You work at a zoo where the animals get to roam free in the fields during the day. But when a storm is coming, you have to bring them back into their pens. You can chase them back or ride them back.

data.title: Back to the Nest
data.author: SQL Sherpa
data.description: Spacebar to fly! Bring a worm back to the nest safely to earn an egg. Produce as many eggs as possible without getting hit by enemy birds.

data.title: Paperback
data.author: vegvarizalan
data.description:
This is a platformer game, with the goal of saving the princess from the 13 vicious enemies.
You have to fight them in increasing difficulty order to finally reach the princess.
All this backwards though...

data.title: Run, Run... RUN!
data.author: sgq995
data.description: Just a running game, as the theme is "back", you've always seen the back of the character.

data.title: Got your back!
data.author: inn3r
data.description:
DESCRIPTION:
The killer whales are trying to kill our little penguin friend but he does NOT have to worry because you got his back!

data.title: Block Hammer
data.author: CodeChomper
data.description: Break the blocks before they fly off the bottom of the screen and you will earn points. Let the blocks fly past and your score will go BACKwards.

data.title: Protect The Base
data.author: Zhi
data.description: A game inspired by Dota's last hitting mechanics. Don't let your base fall as you get the last hit on creeps and obtain gold. Utilize your special skill "backtrack" to push the enemy back and give you a tiny bit of breathing room!

data.title: Backout
data.author: eguneys
data.description:
It's an avoidance game. Use arrow keys to control paddles to avoid hitting the ball. Use space to speed up the ball to
earn more points.

data.title: Meadow
data.author: Jason Alvarez
data.description: A small story game of a bunny that fell down into a cave and makes its way back to it's bunny friends.

data.title: watchmyback
data.author: John Swana
data.description: watchmyback game eat candies before they turn into bugs and shoot at you as a head start you have a free ladybug bodyguard eat more ladybugs foods for more body guards , use direction keys for control and touch buttons for touch enabled devices, for aiming and shooting use the virtual joystick. all insects '🐛', '🐝', '🐜' turn into body guards for web monetisation.

data.title: ZombieBurger
data.author: Olivér Sepsik & Dadi5
data.description: The world is overrun by zombies, they have taken control over your hometown. It is your duty to take it BACK! Also as the sole restaurant owner of the city you have to make sure that every other survivor is well fed. Make salads, cook burgers and kill zombies!

data.title: wolf and sheep
data.author: BOB
data.description: you can use ⬆️⬇️⬅️➡️control the sheep，sheep can move the brown blocks, which the wolf can‘t move them. so the wolf will be besieged be the blocks. good luck.

data.title: Back to Game
data.author: Célio Ighour de Castro Rodrigues
data.description: In a world ruled by digital games, one of them travel to past and try to corrupt classic digital games. Now, you are the only hope for gaming world. Go back to past and destroy the evil! Play through different versions of classic games and win the game. You can play using your mouse by clicking and moving it. Each game has a tutorial explaining how it works and how can you beat the boss. There is two modes of play, with different benefits. For Coil subscribers, you can revive yourself when you lose a game and try again from that game and not from beginning.

data.title: Coiner
data.author: Phong Duong
data.description:
Help coiner collect the coin above him and bring it back to his chest.
Click to play.

data.title: Backsteroid
data.author: dunin
data.description:
Backsteroid is like Asteroid but you must move with the recoil of your canon!
It's hard and it's multiplayer!

data.title: Circle Back
data.author: Johnonym
data.description: This game is a game to test your memory. Circles will appear, and you need to click the circles in the opposite order as they appear. For each level, the number of circles will increase by one. Coil subscribers will have the option to restart the level, being able to see the order of the circles appearing once more. They also get an expensive gold frame instead of a black one.

data.title: firedrone
data.author: JOHN SWANA
data.description: mushroom picking with a drone are you serious lets do this manage a small mushroom garden. your task is to harvest mushrooms growing from the ground once fully grown collect the mushrooms the points awarded depends on the radius of the mushrooms. for 50 pts you can use 2X to enlarge the mushrooms. the rain drop to boost germination rate. the bomb to speed up harvesting processes use the joystick for flying around. I used tinymusic , and zzsfx for sound effects.

data.title: Backshooter
data.author: eguneys
data.description: Left/Right Arrow to move, Down arrow to limit jump, when released you get a jump boost. Up arrow to change gravity, on highlighted areas. Avoid spikes, reach the goal.

data.title: Luon
data.author: Phong Duong
data.description: Luon is a creature from planet Noul. It is trying to find a way to its home planet. Help it avoid dark blocks. Click to play

data.title: Detro
data.author: James Black
data.description: In Detro you fly your jetpack powered alien while shooting creatures in space. Careful where you shoot, your bullets come back towards you and can kill you. Powerups offer shield protection from enemies, shooting many enemies quickly increases your combo score. A 10X combo spawns another powerup, a 15X combo spawns an extra life. Collect the green points from killing enemies to unlock the mega weapon which destroys all enemies. Survive long enough and you may encounter the Boss.

data.title: Eat My Dust!
data.author: Junsik Shim
data.description:
An educational game to increase your typing skills.
Race against your previous records and outrun them.

data.title: Backside Ball
data.author: Vertfromage
data.description: A funny arcade style paddle game. Make the gremlin drop his coins. Collect coins to slow ball. Control the paddles separately using A/D, Left/Right keys or together with mouse or tap.

data.title: MeMo
data.author: Piotr Półtorak
data.description: Memory game for kids and adults

data.title: Can't Get Back
data.author: kipkat
data.description: The player is stuck in a world where everything disappears as you pass by it. You must activate the generators in order to activate the bomb that will help you escape from this world.

data.title: Xycore
data.author: Daniel '64Mega' Lawrence
data.description: Xycore is a 'throwback' to some old favorites, taking inspiration from Hero Core and Metroid to bring you a simple adventure on an unknown planet - take on the four bosses and destroy the reactor core!

data.title: Back 2 Back
data.author: David Stark
data.description: Fighting back to back against an onslaught of alien forces that destroyed your homeworld, you are the two remaining ace pilots of the Earth Defense Force. As the surviving remnants of humanity flee to safety, you must stand your ground against the attackers to buy them time.

data.title: Kitaku
data.author: Brian Hambley
data.description:
Your friends have wandered off again and got lost in the lush greenery of the countryside but without their phones are unable to get back home.
You, Tony, must find them and bring them back.

data.title: BACKSPACE - Return to planet Figadore
data.author: picosonic
data.description: It's 50 years since humans first went to the moon. Now that we are planning to go back, the Regoliths need to escape before we find them. They have light-jumped to planet Figadore in the Hercules cluster to flee.

data.title: back to exploration
data.author: Diego Cardoso
data.description: Perhaps a game inspired by the theory of evolution, catchphrases and the current conjuncture of the world. Just press space bar.

data.title: Back in Black
data.author: jameswilddev
data.description: Get in, get it, get out; your job is to nick the power source of each level. Once you do, however, the lights go out and you have to find your way back blind!

data.title: Go Back
data.author: m-sadeea
data.description:
you can play only with mouse.
When you start the game, a path of yellow cells will be drawn, after seconds, it will disappear, you have to go back from the last cell to the first one but on the same path, if you choose the right cell, it will turn to green, if you choose a cell on the path but not the next one, it will turn to light blue, if you choose the wrong one, it will turn to "X".
you can always get a hint .. there is no time limits.

data.title: Backstabbers
data.author: Milan Donhowe
data.description: Backstabbers is a game where you play as a robot who kills assigned targets while avoiding contact with their past self and wrong targets.

data.title: DeStar
data.author: PerK
data.description: This is a puzzle game where you use your Astronaut to collect gold nuggets in a labyrinth. There are some difficulties to navigate in zero gravity and you will have some limitations in how you can move. Your android can assist you while you float, but your android cannot collect the nuggets.

data.title: Back to the Battle Ship
data.author: Jorge Rubiano
data.description: Go back to the roots of the game, in Back to the Battle Ship, you can evoke the time in which you only needed pencil and paper to enjoy a good time.

data.title: Bring The Number Back
data.author: Sergey Chernykh
data.description: Robot challenges you to guess its number before it guesses yours.

data.title: Dottie Back to Sun
data.author: Jesse McNulty
data.description:
Story:
Dottie, a solar flare, blasted off to the other side of the galaxy during an event. Our mission is to get Dottie back to reunite with the Sun.

data.title: Shoot2Live
data.author: runtimeTerror
data.description: This is a shooting game where you can't see back, you need to shoot the enemies by predicting their positions in dark......Make 60 to win the game

data.title: Fat Kids on Trampoline
data.author: baturinsky
data.description:
Neighborhood kids caught a wind of you getting a giant trampoline and want to play.
Though, they have no safety training, so you have no choice but politely send them BACK.
They may object, but a strong enough kick makes them lose control temporarily, letting you usher them out.
You get a point for each de-trampolined kid.
If you fall off, you lose 5 points.

Game ends when there are 15 kids present (including you).

data.title: Back 2 Home
data.author: Sipmann
data.description: A game about a cat (yes, that's a cat) that want to go back to home. Pink/Red spike ball are enemies. To move the cat, just use the arrow keys. Reach the build to get at home and go to the next level.

data.title: Puzzle from hell
data.author: frederic charette
data.description: In Hell, they force you to solve puzzles only using the BACKside of the pieces!

data.title: The Martians are Back!
data.author: Schnark
data.description: The Martians are back! They are trying to invade earth again, and it’s up to you to defeat them!

data.title: Turtleback
data.author: J'Brian
data.description: Oh no the turtle is on its back! Help the turtle flip over. Press R to start, press A and D (or Q and D, or arrow keys) to rock the turtle enough to flip over.

data.title: PUZZLEggs
data.author: Jani Nykänen
data.description: PUZZLEggs is a puzzle game where you control a bird who want to get his/her eggs back. The goal is to collect every egg in the stage and then return to the starting position. You may not stomp the eggs you have already collected, so try not to get stuck!

data.title: Back in Dino
data.author: Nicolantonio Vignola
data.description: Dino is stuck in time. He can't walk back in the past... he can just moonwalk. He can't go in the future either. The only thing left for him is to enjoy the present also it is not that easy, especially when some weird circles try to catch him. Help Dino to stay alive and enjoy the present time. Commands:

data.title: Back & Forth
data.author: Gagik Papikyan
data.description: Save little Bob: try to escape the clock hands, trying to kick him out!

data.title: Toe-Tac-Tic
data.author: rutimeTerror
data.description:
This is back-ward Tic-Tak-Toe, in this, you lose the game
if you make 3 consecutive X or O...........
This game is made in 2 modes:
1) To play with the browser
2) To play with friends offline

data.title: Snake vs Invaders
data.author: Baturinsky
data.description: Shoot'em UP with Arkanoid mechanics, i.e. instead of dodging bullets, you try to deflect them with your body back at enemy.

data.title: Dodge That Shit
data.author: chrischongyj
data.description: Dodge pieces of shit falling from the ceiling!

data.title: Oh, My Poor Rheumatic Back
data.author: inlbe
data.description: Use the cursor keys or WAD keys.

data.title: Reverse Simon
data.author: Nicola
data.description:
The reversed version of Simon!
Pay attention while the sequence is played, then replicate it BACKWARDS!

data.title: Anti-gravity cave
data.author: Artur Augusto Martins
data.description: Explore a strange anti-gravity cave where rooms you never go back.

data.title: Lights Back On
data.author: Alejandro Molina Salazar
data.description:
There is a blackout!
You decide to go alone in the dark and look for the fuse box, but this is not an easy job.
Try to memorize the level before the power outage and be careful with the platforms and traps that you will face on your way.
Don't worry! you always have your lantern ready to help you, but remember that you can only use it once!

data.title: PopBall
data.author: Alba22
data.description:
This is a very simple game.
Your main goal is to hit the balls as fast as you can. If you miss a ball, another ball comes back to the game.
And if there are 20 ball on the screen, you lose.

data.title: Backshot Tactics
data.author: Antonio Salvati
data.description: Pick your ships and try to destroy your opponent

data.title: [SWAGSHOT]
data.author: Rémi Vansteelandt
data.description: The station on LZ-13 was taken over by its AIs! You must take it back... with style!

data.title: Dwarfs: There and Back Again
data.author: mvasilkov
data.description: Dwarfs: There and Back Again is a tale of high adventure, undertaken by a company of dwarfs, in search of dragon-guarded gold, true friendship, and varieties of ale (not necessarily in that order).

data.title: Don't Go Back
data.author: JS636f
data.description: Don't go back - Maze Game

data.title: Get Jess Back
data.author: Randy Tayler
data.description: Get Jess Back is a very short choose-your-own-adventure-style game. Text is displayed below the pictures (you'll have to swipe up a bit to see it on mobile).

data.title: Back To Source
data.author: Shubham
data.description:
Back To Source:
-Player has a data unit as RED BALL that has to be guided its path back to the source node as ORANGE RING NODE through many nodes and connecting lines.
-Player has to control the direction in which the BALL supposed to move following its path to source.
-The ball will move in rings clock/anti-clockwise and its pace raises with every node player follow in its path.
-If ball completes its complete rotation either clock/anti-clockwise in any node other than source ,
this is the only way a player can get out.Although its not going to be easy to play it all along.
-There is almost huge loads of levels to play with.

data.title: Repeewsenim
data.author: Kushagra Gour
data.description: "Repeewsenim" is derived from the classic game of Minesweeper. The twist here is that you need to play it backwards, in reverse. You know where the bombs are and need to put correct numbers on the tiles.

data.title: IT-Man
data.author: Krol22
data.description: Use ARROWS for movement. Use SPACE to make backup. You make backup by stepping on computer first.

data.title: Reverse Invaders
data.author: David Storey
data.description: It's Space Invaders but not as you know it! Use the arrow keys to control the alien horde against the invading human ship! Coil subscribers get faster lasers and bigger explosions!

data.title: The Wandering Wraith
data.author: Mateusz Tomczyk
data.description: A lost wraith is wandering through the world seeking for peace. Will you guide him back to his grave so he can finally rest?

data.title: Ouroboros
data.author: infernet89
data.description: Ouroboros it's a snake that bites its own tail.

data.title: Flight Back Home
data.author: John
data.description: Watch the outbound route of the plane then complete the route back home by tapping on the correct cells in order including the final landing. Be warned if you go off course your plane will crash.

data.title: Tanky McTankface
data.author: Frederik Petersen
data.description: You take control of the tank and try to go as far as you can while fighting enemy turrets. You gather items along the way, but they are not applied instantly. Only when you are destroyed and start back at the beginning, the items will be applied and you will become more powerful. Not all enemies are created equal. Compare Highscores to see how well you did. Use cursor buttons to control the tank and space to charge a shot. You can change audio settings in the menu and get there with escape. From there you can start fresh (without items) or continue the current run.

data.title: How to send back…
data.author: Sebastian Dorn
data.description: The new season of 'How to send back…' airs! The first show was not well received, maybe it was too boring. So the producers thought of something new.

data.title: Eftiell: Back to the Crypt
data.author: dollarone
data.description: You saved the village of Eftiell. You defeated the evil Lich and his minions in that ghastly crypt. But now, a new danger has arisen: the Doom Knight is awake in the very same crypt. You must go back... Back to.the crypt!

data.title: Backo
data.author: kqdiw
data.description: The Interlopers promised great fortune and knowledge, but unsurprisingly, they were nothing but swindlers. During your encounters, you have noticed that these ungodly creatures affect your sanity. Luckily, you have discovered a drastic loophole — do, not, face, them. Countless setbacks and only your trusty twisted blade by your side, will you be able to rescue your waning planet?

data.title: ROW
data.author: Ben Fox
data.description:
Row row row your boat,
quickly back up stream,
frantically frantically,
frantically frantically,
Life will end downstream...
____________________________

data.title: Watch Your Back!
data.author: Rafael Lammel
data.description: You and a robot are all alone in a dark room. He's got a flashlight and you a gun, but he is programmed to aim his flashlight always to your back. It's up to you to make a good communication and survive as long as you can against your enemies!

data.title: Back to Bathroom
data.author: perdugames
data.description: Description:

data.title: Slime'n Says
data.author: Zachary Chavez
data.description: Slimes will play a melody. Play it back correctly to make them happy.

data.title: Infinite Missiles
data.author: Matt McKenna
data.description: Flashback to the 1980s!

data.title: Entangled
data.author: Japheth
data.description:
There was once a pair of quantumly entangled particles that can only get close to each other but can never fuse together. No matter what they do, they are cosmically destined to stay away from each other. All the Quantum Universe's a stage, these two particles merely are players, and can only dance forever in unison.
This is a story about a particle, forever seeking a way back to its soulmate.

data.title: BACKSPACE
data.author: Pioctor Casot
data.description: Make "BACK"s in vertical, horizontal, or diagonal line. Use arrow keys to move the cursor. Use backspace to delete the character at the cursor.

data.title: Regresso
data.author: lopis
data.description: Your ship wrecked in an unkown land. Keep your crew well fed while you struggle your way through finding the resources to rebuild the caravel and get back to the sea. And may god have mercy on you.

data.title: Grow Back
data.author: Dmitriy Kurovskiy
data.description:
Use arrow keys to control the bee, and fly from flower to flower to transfer pollen and create new flowers.
Each flower, while it exists, produces grass and protects from the sand.
The ultimate goal is to fill the whole game space with grass in minimum time.

data.title: Watch_Your_Back
data.author: Teerex studios
data.description:
You are a spy and your goal is to escape the building you are trapped into.
Use WASD to move the spy and Space to boost your speed.
Beware of the traps or you might "fall back".
Don't get caught and find the hidden exit.

data.title: Time Runner
data.author: Marek Łabuz
data.description: Time Runner is a game where you have to use your agility to stay on the path. Different types of obstacles are there to stop you. Collect diamonds, because you are going to need them, trust me. Control your character with arrows keys. If you happen to make a mistake, there is always a way to turn back time...

data.title: BackFlipped
data.author: Tom Hermans (Auroriax)
data.description: Fall to bottom to flip to the back, then fall back up on the other side... How long can you keep switching between the back and front of the stage? Game by Tom Hermans (@Auroriax). Best played in Chrome or Firefox.

data.title: Dawn Breaker
data.author: Roger Qi
data.description: You are a wanderer in the dark, persued by unnamable hordes, use your arsenal of light to eliminate enemies and dawn the world.Controls: press [Z] to throw back flash bangs, press [X] to deploy flash mines.Each blast will draw the dawn nearer and when the dawn breaks you beat the game.Good luck !

data.title: Super Backpacking Adventure
data.author: David Brad
data.description: Dust off those dice, and get ready to roll through a SUPER backpacking adventure!

data.title: Backionary
data.author: Petah
data.description: Backionary word game where you try to guess the written word backwards.

data.title: angle
data.author: Bob Hwang
data.description:
Eliminate weeds using missiles.
Missiles can only fire backward.
Weeds continue to grow.

data.title: VicBlitz
data.author: Dave
data.description: Come with me, back to the early '80s - coming home from school to try and grab a few hours with my Vic20 before my Dad came home and I lost the TV. I'd like to help you experience what it was like back then as we play a remake of my favourite Vic20 game - AstroBlitz - combined with a classic 80's movie - Firefox.

data.title: Encoded Maze
data.author: liruenth
data.description: You tried to find some kids lost in a cave but ended up lost yourself.

data.title: sing-song ding-song
data.author: Richard Munn
data.description:
sing-song ding-dong
a js13games 2019 entry by richard munn

data.title: Back To That Platform I Was On Before Jumping
data.author: Bruno Konrad
data.description: This is a game about returning one step to enable two or more.

data.title: Rectangles
data.author: Locisvv
data.description: Just try to survive using left and right buttons.

data.title: BiT - Back in Time
data.author: Frenchfaso
data.description:
BiT (Back in Time)
A compact multithreaded (webworkers) raycasting recursive maze generator/game developed for JS13k 2019.
Use WASD to move forward/backward and strafe left/right.
Use your mouse to look around.
You have 60 seconds to find the exit.

data.title: Bounce Back
data.author: Frank Force
data.description:
When life gets you down,
it's never too late to...

data.title: Cindy's Nightmare
data.author: Rojen Maharjan
data.description:
Cindy is forever stuck in her nightmare. Each time she reaches the end, she gets thrown back to the beginning. There’s no hope of getting out of it, so why not have fun killing the ghosts and getting a high score?
Controls:
Press [Space] to fire. Press [W] or [↑] to jump. Press [A] [D] or [←] [→] to move Left and Right. Use [Shift] to sprint.

data.title: Comeback
data.author: Mracv
data.description: You want to be an Astronaut, but before you become an Astronaut you should train a lot. This summer, you have the opportunity to take part in an training program to improve your skills. You will have to visit different planets before you become an Astronaut. Do you will comeback to the Earth?

data.title: Dr. Scoliosis, M.D.
data.author: Rohin Dasari
data.description: Defeat Dr. Scoliosis, M.D. by completing rhythm patterns. Complete a hard pattern to inflict more damage. Complete a easy pattern to inflict smaller damage. Watch out, you may become his next victim.

data.title: Quick Wins
data.author: Ryan Tyler
data.description: Run and jump through 22 levels collecting coins to open the portal to the next. Avoid enemies, melting blocks. climb ladders in a race against the clock.

data.title: Backstabber Hero
data.author: Niklas Berg
data.description: This is the story of the mysterious backstabber hero. Whilst most people carry on with their carefree lives and sleep safe at nights the backstabbing hero is taking care of worlds backstabbing chores.

data.title: Back to the 80s
data.author: Ed Lynch
data.description: Move - WASD

data.title: Sopwith Back
data.author: elementalsystems
data.description: A homage to the 1984 game SOPWITH. A game exploring the video technology available between 1984 and today.

data.title: Back to life
data.author: Serpent7776
data.description: Use arrows to move, space to attack.

data.title: Jet Back Gravity
data.author: Dmytro Kozhukhar
data.description: Controls : [Left] + [Right] + [Up] or [Space]. Or [Mouse] or [Touch] (it's even friendlier). Contol the ship inside the planet's gravity field by pointing it's propulsion engine. Destroy the approaching asteroids with the engine jet. Don't let the aseroids hit a Planet.

data.title: Godai is back
data.author: LuisQuin
data.description: Godai is back

data.title: Bubba's Back Room
data.author: Eric Rowell
data.description: You just started a new job at a creepy gas station. Your boss tells you to go to the back and meet his son, Bubba junior. But something doesn't quite seem right...

data.title: Palindrome
data.author: Daivan Trinh
data.description:
Use the Arrow Keys.
Your goal is to move to the green node, when you reach the green node, it will take all the steps, you've taken but in reverse and you need to reach the red node.
You lose if you touch an enemy.
There is no music to the game.
There are only 3 levels.
This has been a great learning experiance, thanks for hosting this event!
Regards Daivan Trinh and Håkan Einarsson

data.title: AI, Begone!
data.author: Tatjam
data.description: Back the human revolution against an evil AI in this perma-death orbital-physics shoot-them-up!

data.title: Jewelsback
data.author: Erick Petrucelli
data.description: A match-3 inspired game created for the js13kGames competition, just click and drag jewels (or touch on mobile devices) and move to create horizontally or vertically matches of the same type. The game has 13 levels and the win is achieved when reaching score 13000.

data.title: Back from Kooky Island
data.author: Alexander Curtis
data.description: While lost at sea you discover a mysterious island. Can you find a way to get back home? Use the Arrow Keys to move, Space to jump, and Enter to interact with objects.

data.title: The Backlash
data.author: Karan Bhatt
data.description: After 200 years of tyrannical rule of the Empire, the people had borne enough. The White Capes emerged as a backlash to the injustice faced. Violence was inevitable; the revolution was unstoppable. Help the White Capes overthrow the King.

data.title: Playback
data.author: Adrian Lissot
data.description:
Playback is an ordered platformer game.
Press the playback button to see (and hear) how the level must be played, and play it back.
Keyboard and gamepads are supported.
The freeplay mode lets you play some music with your keyboard. Some song examples (QWERTY) are included. Feel free to share your own !
Tips:
-Press Space, Triangle or Y for level playback
-You can stick to walls

data.title: Letchworth Village
data.author: Elliot Nelson
data.description: Send demons BACK TO HELL in this 2D top-down button masher. As an immortal demon hunter possessed by a cursed sword, you awaken in Letchworth Village, an abandoned mental hospital in the midst of an ongoing demon invasion. Drown your sword in demon blood and close the portal to hell for good!

data.title: Back to oxygen
data.author: joorce
data.description:
You control a nanorobot with the task to clean the clouds by breaking toxic molecules back to oxygen.
Use UP to accelerate, DOWN to brake and LEFT and RIGHT to turn.
Catch the blue (oxygen) molecules and avoid the rest.

data.title: Scroll!
data.author: Zeev Katz
data.description:
Scroll! is a Face to Face fighting game for mobile that you can play in your browser.
To win 🏆, scroll fast and hard as you can to raise your score by pushing your opponent up!

data.title: Back Home
data.author: workshopcraft
data.description: Your goal is to make your way back home after a holiday with your family. Mouse to start the game(click on the menu entries) Controls are WASD. There are no settings in the settings menu. The game has a beginning, a middle and an end :).

data.title: Saptcha
data.author: Konrad Linkowski
data.description: Saptcha - Slightly Automated Public Turing test to tell Computers Humans Apart

data.title: Llama Adventure
data.author: Thiago Barcala
data.description: Help the Llama to collect its items and bring them back home.

data.title: Infiltration
data.author: Siorki
data.description:
- Master, here are the plans of the Death Cube. We can fire a torpedo into this exhaust vent, going straight to the reactor core. This is our only chance.
- Padawan, this is 2019. Let's send an unmanned drone into the main entrance, cloak it so that the Cube's defences will ignore it, and remote control it until it reaches the reactor.
- But master, how can we avoid all the obstacles inside and still reach our destination ?
- Easy, easy. If anything goes wrong, use the Force to send the spacecraft back in time.
- Back in time ? Is that even possible ?

data.title: Entombed
data.author: Stuart Lee
data.description: You've been buried alive in the mad king's tomb! Can you find your way back to the surface?

data.title: SenTetrox
data.author: sirxemic
data.description:
A variant on a famous classic where the tetrominoes are sentient! The tetrominoes will flee *back* up when they have figured out their purpose in the playing field (to die to make lines)!
Depending on your playing style it might take a while before you see one leave the game.
Good luck and thank you for playing!

data.title: Way Out
data.author: SamirH
data.description: The door is locked. You'll have to explore a dangerous dungeon full of traps and monsters and find 4 lost gems to open the door and get your WAY OUT!

data.title: Get Back Up
data.author: David Durham
data.description: Help the egg get back up the tree.

data.title: A ship in time
data.author: dodormeur
data.description: Oh no ! Your ship is trapped in a parallel dimension, where it is going back in time ! Instead of gaining upgrade and becoming more powerful as time passes on, it losses upgrades ! Lucky for you, your ship is very well equipped, and can select which useless upgrade to lose first. How long will you survive, and how small can your ship get?

data.title: Fight back
data.author: Floriico
data.description: A small roguelite, use arrow key to move and spacebar to rest and heal.

data.title: Back to the Island
data.author: Andrew J. Baker
data.description: Avoid the critters roaming the grasslands and make your way to the chequered flag to advance to the next island. Rinse and repeat.

data.title: Deserter
data.author: Urh Primožič
data.description: Game about the strugle of return and the sad ending of the journey back home. You play as an soilder, running from meaningles war. Dodge bombs and bullets using the recoil of your gun. Shoot bombs, if you dare. try not to get yourself killed. Use your mouse to aim and left mouse to shoot. On mobile, tap to shoot. Coil subscribers have acces to another game mode with cool techno vibes and can fly around with their automatic canon. Physic is for poor people.

data.title: Back to Skull Island
data.author: Amy and Steven Frieson
data.description: King Kong survived his fall off the Empire State Building and just wants to get home now.

data.title: Back on Track
data.author: Fu & Fan
data.description: You are an air traffic controller working at Boston Logan Airport. Your job is to direct landing and get aircrafts back on track. You will be fired if crash happens or too many aircrafts get lost.

data.title: Byte Rider
data.author: Frank Mitchell
data.description: Byte Rider is a two player card game, you against an AI. On your turn you may take one action...

data.title: Game of Backstabbers
data.author: Michael Wolken-Möhlmann
data.description:
The king is old and has no heir. He will give the hand of his daughter to the most powerful lord of one of three houses. You support your house by gathering resources and paying tribute to the king. The crown will be awarded to the first house to gain the king's favor.
But only the strongest lord of a house can become the next king. So better watch out for competitors of your own house.

data.title: Back to Life Adventure
data.author: Lance Ewing
data.description: A short graphic adventure game where you play the Reaper, travelling back in time to (ironically) bring everyone else back to life! The only problem is, you can't remember who you are, or where you are.

data.title: Don't Shoot Back
data.author: David Damian (wisekrakr)
data.description: The Game is an asteroids homage. It is the Dark Souls of space games. Super hard to get to the end. Survive for 5 minutes while asteroids bump into you and enemies try to destroy you. Protect planets from falling asteroids and escort helpless travelers. Accumulate points by dodging lasers and making them hit asteroids. Make enemies follow you into a asteroid belt or meteor storm and let them destroy themselves. Do all this for 5 minutes and fight The Boss of Space! And then BACK to work.

data.title: 20461 Dioretsa
data.author: burntcustard
data.description: Named after the damocloid, (and Asteroids... backwards) 20461 Dioretsa is a local multiplayer Asteroids-like.

data.title: BACK
data.author: dos
data.description: you can only go back

data.title: LOST ROBOT
data.author: Dennis Meckel
data.description: > If I'd written the mapping module, it wouldn't be offline!

data.title: Back Read
data.author: Felladrin
data.description: Challenge your brain in this reverse-reading game!

data.title: Back To The Stars
data.author: Marco Fernandes
data.description:
Help our friend to get back to the stars by jumping into the falling bubbles.
Move using the arrow keys and space to jump.

data.title: We fight back!
data.author: Christian Paul
data.description:
Giant monsters are roaming through the world, threatening your town and family.
In this typing game, you're defending your city against a giant monster by typing the displayed story.

data.title: BounceBack
data.author: LNY
data.description:
A simple shooting game.You have a shield on your back which can bounce back the bullets.
Your character's direction is controlled by mouse pointer.X to move toward pointer,C to shoot bullets,P to pause/continue.

data.title: Back Back Back Back Gone!
data.author: Jon Wiesman
data.description: Back Back Back Back Gone is a home run derby for mobile and desktop. Just tap on the screen where the ball crosses the plate to swing the bat.

data.title: back to rescue
data.author: salc2
data.description:
Back to Rescue.
Rescue as many hostages as you can.
Go forward and carry them in your BACK and get BACK until the extraction area.
SPACE/ENTER - GUNFIRE
ARROW UP - JUMP
ARROWS LEFT/RIGHT - WALK
It's so much buggy but I hope you enjoy.

data.title: Round Robin
data.author: ai Doge & Jack Oatley
data.description:
Round robin, slide down and up the hills to jump, use arrow keys to boost mid air! and collect coins.
Coil subscribers can get amazing color pallets by pressing Q.

data.title: Big Fish
data.author: Mark Racette
data.description:
Become the biggest fish in the pond. The rules are simple:
1. Use the arrow keys to avoid larger fish
2. Eat smaller fish to grow in size
3. Beware of odd-sized fish
4. Tails do not count towards collisions
5. Collect bonus items to gain points and power-ups
6. Become the biggest fish in the pond to win

data.title: Back...to where we left off
data.author: Adrian PETRE
data.description: Forced to sit in the shadows for an entire year after narrowly escaping being caught, the hacker returns behind the monitor in hope that this time he will find the answers to some peculiar questions the average human has.

data.title: Dengar
data.author: Andrew Patton
data.description: "Anime fans across the world have succesfully raided Area 51, but poor Dengar here quite enjoyed his containment facility"

data.title: nano-wirebot
data.author: Mariano Lambir
data.description:
A simple platformer where you play as a nanobot that needs to fix some wires.
Use the arrow keys for movement, and the browser back button (or backspace) to "go back"

data.title: Back Down The Tower
data.author: Quang & Kevin
data.description: In this game, you've most definitely defeated the boss, and you just need to go back down the tower to go home and buy groceries and walk your dog (groceries and dog not part of the game).

data.title: Behind the Scenery
data.author: madmarcel
data.description: Totally unfinished very buggy puzzle platformer.

data.title: Tube Masters
data.author: Zack Urben
data.description:
In Tube Masters, you play daredevil who is tubing down the side of a mountain. Pay attention and avoid the obstacles, while trying to get the highest score
possible!

data.title: oh, flip!
data.author: Bryan Perfetto
data.description:
oh, flip!
a game about backflips

data.title: Yet Another Doom Clone
data.author: Nicholas Carlini
data.description: It's yet another doom clone.

data.title: SNAKE IT BACK
data.author: Ovilia
data.description: The died snakes become new obstacles. Earn your immortality!

data.title: Return to the Moon
data.author: Luke / Deathray
data.description: A very quick game that is a tribute to the moon landing and the lunar landing games that followed.

data.title: Awkward Turtle
data.author: Diana and Andrew
data.description: Awkward Turtle is awkward. Help him avoid all social media interactions using the arrow keys to reach the winning score of 13k!

data.title: Beat Bricks
data.author: KeithK
data.description: A rhythm based brick breaker with high scores for Coil subscribers. Move with your mouse or finger, and tap along with the 1's, 2's or 4's to power up your shots.

data.title: LibreCraft
data.author: darkenvy
data.description: LibreCraft is the liberation of the famous voxel game for all browsers. GPU is not required and plays on any machine. Settings exist to modify performance and a saving mechanism is included to save the games in the browser.

data.title: ape naps
data.author: samuel pare-chouinard
data.description:
in this game you play as mama ape carrying her three baby apes back home on her back and to some Bach, so she can finally nap.
Controls:
left=a, right=d, space=jump, w=wiggle

data.title: bakpak
data.author: nes + egghead
data.description:
Find your way through the spoopy forest while defeating bosses and finding new extensions for your bakpak.
Controls: AD- move, W- jump Mouse- use bakpak item, 1/2- switch bakpak item
Once you defeat the spider boss, you'll get the grapple which let's you grapple to hooks. You can switch between flashlight and grapple with 1 and 2.
The game wasn't finished, so prepare for some weird transitions and bugs...

data.title: Fall Back!
data.author: Delish Games
data.description: After an experimental security drone goes haywire, there's only one thing the scientists in the lab can do, fall back! Escape through a maze-like lab in the pitch dark with a murderous robot hot on your heels.

data.title: Back Scratching Salon
data.author: Jorengarenar
data.description: Simple, one-file IDLE game.

data.title: Backpack Monsters
data.author: Santiago Zapata
data.description: Explore the world looking for monsters, can you find the legendary ones? share your discoveries with your friends! As a Coil subscriber your action points will recover much quicker.

data.title: Game of Ur
data.author: huijari
data.description: This is an interpretation of the rules of the ancient Game of Ur, possibly a predecessor of the Backgammon. It's a two-player race board game, here the players take turns tossing 4 coins to move their pieces through the board. The first player to ascend (take off the board after completing the course) 7 pieces win.

data.title: xx142-b2.exe
data.author: Ben & Salvatore
data.description: Hello, xx142-b2.exe

data.title: Bring Back the Berries
data.author: jedulz
data.description: Play as a porcupine in this survival game!

data.title: Ninja Take Back
data.author: Roger Winright
data.description: This game is meant for local multiplayer - 2 people, 1 keyboard.

data.title: THE DATA BACKUP
data.author: $hipr@
data.description:
- There are code units with their respective programming language protocol in the server space.
- Player has to connect the units of same programming language and make a loop to confirm backup of that collection of data. Example: you connect all the 'C#' units with other 'C#' units and then connect the last with the first unit and then this collection will be backup and cleared from server space.
- Player have initial 60 seconds for performing backup and as player score time also increase and hence player can score as high he/she can within the available time.
- If time run out to ZERO, then GAME will be OVER.

data.title: Slipstream 13k
data.author: ThirtyThree Games
data.description: Challenge your friends and watch your back in this multiplayer action trench-flying racer. Enter a room code (or make anything up), share it with your friends, and hit enter to start a match. Controls are arrow keys to turn, space to boost, and Z to shoot.

data.title: Push Back
data.author: Lomateron & Erik
data.description: In Push Back you create currents to help the stranded boats get back to the mainland. This game uses fluid dynamics to simulate the water.

data.title: FALL BACK HERO
data.author: Gotshi, Tayrassin, Tricsi
data.description: In 2091 a meteor landed on earth, and an alien lifeform appeared with it. Not so far away from the meteor, the alien lifeform has been settled in a cave. An elite squad of 3 men have been sent to the cave to secure the area for further research. But then suddenly...

data.title: BACKSIDE
data.author: Fu & Fan
data.description:
Use ↑ and ↓ to jump and flip, use ← and → to move.
Get the key to enter the next level, try to flip back to pass blockers!

data.title: Crystal Blast
data.author: Jared York
data.description: Your spaceship ran out of fuel. You had to make an emergency landing on an unknown planet. Obtain the nine energy crystals scattered around the world to get back to orbit. Drill and build ladders throughout the world to help yourself get around.

data.title: Time remnants - go back in time and fix the timeline
data.author: Bartosz Cytrowski
data.description:
Time remnants
A game about going back in time and fixing the timeline. Very minimalistic ;)

data.title: Rebound
data.author: Michał Kuliński & Michał Skowronek
data.description: Action RTS game in pixel art village world (This is Poland for sure - look at the cows!)

data.title: Electro
data.author: Animax
data.description:
Pitch:
In this Tetris like, your goal is to make lines from left to right with tiles of the same shape, connected by side or by corner.

data.title: Retrohaunt
data.author: Donitz
data.description: Someone or something is stealing our time. Today was yesterday and tomorrow is nowhere to be seen. Detective Clay is on the case!

data.title: Triangle: Back To Home
data.author: Viktor Uhryn
data.description: You are lost in the cave. Try to get out and back to home. Sometimes it can be easy, sometimes not… but don’t give up and you will do it.

data.title: Pizza Undelivery
data.author: Nils Gawlik
data.description: Here you bring pizzas back to the pizzeria, instead of the other way around. This retro style racing game is about navigating a randomly generated 3D city in your 1986 Toyota Corolla, while listening to hand-coded floatbeat music and sound effects. Another highlight is the custom 3D rendering engine implemented in JavaScript (that might not work on slower machines, sorry).

data.title: Humpback Revenge
data.author: gorgovic
data.description: Help angry humpback whale get his revenge on the fishermen.

data.title: We Must Go Back!
data.author: ByGm3
data.description:
Description:
[insert generic character name here] in his endless run to some goal (I guess) just remembered that he forgot to turn off his stove. Of course is easier to keep the momentum and run backwards (speedrunning tactics). Help him to achieve that.
SPOILERS: This is a endless runners, you will never help him.

data.title: Traversor
data.author: Hundao
data.description:
Life is struggle, you have to overcome the challenge again and again.
Death does not stop you from moving forward but gives up can. Keep trying because you are Trevasor.

data.title: Backspace It
data.author: Erwin Andres
data.description: Delete characters with the backspace key as they appears in the screen.

data.title: BackStone
data.author: Elvis Rozario, Nishad Wadwekar
data.description: The world is on the verge of destruction and you are one of the last surviving ships left of our species. In the modern age of discoveries and technology, we've found a stone capable of doing something that we never even dreamt of, "get you BACK in time".We started calling these stones as BackStones.These stones can be found spread across the galaxy.

data.title: Tilted
data.author: Olivér Sepsik
data.description: Play the game by tilting your phone! You are tasked with rolling balls back into their place. Play through 30 different levels and create custom ones with the powerful level editor that was designed for phones!

data.title: Back Attacker
data.author: Yeon Juan
data.description:
Invaders have entered in the Ninja’s Forest. Be careful!, They have weapons. Attack behind the back.
Control the Ninja with arrow keys (↑, ↓, →, ←)

data.title: Back to Earth
data.author: Matthew Diamant
data.description: DESTROY OR BE DESTROYED! Defend Earth against the exiled enemy forces who have come back to Earth to seek their revenge. You alone must defeat these treacherous villains, but help can be found back on Earth with ship upgrades and repairs.

data.title: Fall_Back!
data.author: Nick and Dave
data.description:
Mission:
Your team is overwhelmed! Fall back and survive as long as possible.

data.title: Back on Track (mania)
data.author: Xem & Nghia
data.description: Read the full making-of here: https://xem.github.io/articles/js13k19.html

data.title: JSRacer
data.author: GregPeck
data.description:
JSRACER is a drone racing game.
You start each track with an countdown.
Rings on the course allows you to add time.

data.title: Pattern Unlocked
data.author: Vishwas Paikra
data.description:
use arrows or W-A-S-D to move left,right,up,down.
press shift to move faster. Press space-bar to shoot bullets.press i for info of current stage if available.pres number 1,2,3,4 to mover bars/ and r to reset the position of bars{it's like bars of a jail} and 'b' to reset the pink buttons.click the pink buttons in a particular pattern to open the gates.

data.title: Troposphere
data.author: Sami H & Tero J
data.description: TROPOSPHERE

data.title: Conflict Management
data.author: Markus Fisch
data.description: Turn-based conflict management like it was back in the day.

data.title: Bounce It Back
data.author: SANS
data.description: BOUNCE IT BACK

data.title: Back Online!
data.author: Ayman
data.description: You just got back online! Trex ended up getting stuck in the devtools network tab and now has to survive the waterfall of all the requests coming into the browser! How many kbs you think trex can survive ?

data.title: VOIDCALL
data.author: Phoboslab
data.description: A real time strategy game with a low poly sci-fi theme.

data.title: Back to School
data.author: Fawwaz Muhammad
data.description: This game is about math. The objective of this game is to achieve the goal shown on the right corner of the screen before running out of steps. It really requires you to have backward thinking. enumerating all possibilities from the goal to the initial value.

data.title: 2AP: Backyard Assault
data.author: Baturinsky
data.description: It's a tiny XCOM-like.

data.title: Scroll Run
data.author: Bartek Szopka
data.description:
It's a quick and simple game about running as fast as you can, and then running back again ;)
I woke up with an idea for this on a Sunday morning just before the end of the competition and decided to implement it quickly.
I found it quite fun (and have learned some things!), hope you will as well.

data.title: Start Over
data.author: Miguel Silva
data.description:
Start over is a very short puzzle platform game.
When the user presses the space bar, it will send them back to the beginning of the level with a clone of the previous attempt.

data.title: Numerical Error
data.author: Miguel Ángel Pérez Martínez
data.description: I run out of time... I wish I could turn *back* one month.

data.title: The Back-up of YOU
data.author: kurazu
data.description:
Fly a spaceship through a randomly generated level.
Use LEFT, RIGHT and UP ARROWS to steer.
You need to finish the level within given time.
Then interesting stuff starts happening under the hood - an AI is trained first on your data, then is improving further without human supervision. After a while (the airmiles are really just a progress meter) you will get a chance to race against the trained alogorithm. While you will be racing the improvements will be still ongoing, so each next race you start is going to be against an improved AI (the generation is indicated in the name of the bot player).

data.title: Space Wizard Toast Spinning
data.author: fatfisz
data.description: Click or point and drag to cast magick on a spinning slice of toast!

data.title: The Empire Str13ks Back
data.author: agar3s
data.description:
I couldnt make it on time... but here is my entry:
This is a game based on Star wars second movie "The Empire Strikes Back" the game is a collection of microgames representing different stages of the jedi training and some actions scenes from the movie.
Controls are Space and arrow keys.

data.title: send the asteroids back
data.author: Not So Iron Fists Game Corp
data.description: asteroids are fliying through space towards earth, with your plasma wall building hammer send them back and save the earth!

data.title: Backcountry
data.author: Piesku
data.description: Kill or be killed in this hack-and-shoot set in the Wild West! Use the mouse or tap the screen to control your avatar, and earn as much gold as you can from the sheriff's bounties.

data.title: Super Bunny Strikes Back!
data.author: FoumartGames
data.description: Help Kitty hopp through 13 stages in the dark forest full of savage animals to rescue Bunny lost !

data.title: Cursed
data.author: Lucas Drummond
data.description:
Controls: W - up, A - left, S - down, D - right, Space - shoot, Mouse - Aim
| You, a shapeshifting cursor, were cursed, losing your ability to change shape. You were cast forward into the depths of the browser. Fight evil spirits and rediscover your shapes as you travel back to your home.

data.title: Play Back
data.author: madmaw
data.description: Oh no, you've been kicked out of the castle! Solve puzzles and make your way back to your rightful home.

data.title: Backspace Magic
data.author: CHCH
data.description:
[Instruction]
Arrow Key: Move
Enter/Space: Choose, Cast spell
Backspace: Backspace!

data.title: Throw back
data.author: Anej Gorkič
data.description: Simple two player game. You have 3 seconds to throw BACK a ticking bomb that will explode after 10 seconds. Catch the right timing to trick your opponent. Play as many rounds as you want.

data.title: Bot's Back
data.author: Jordan J Watkins
data.description: Bot and Company have finally returned from years of questing only to find that home is not what they left behind.

data.title: I Want to Help Fight the Demon Overlord, but I’m Just an Intern!
data.author: Dietrich Epp
data.description: You want to defeat the demon overlord, but you’re just an intern! Go back to town and fetch us some potions.
